text: Sir William Nigel Paul Cash (born 10 May 1940) is a British Conservative politician. He was a Member of Parliament (MP) from 1984 until 2024. He was first elected for Stafford and then for Stone in Staffordshire in 1997. After his tenth election victory in the 2019 general election, aged 79, Cash became the oldest sitting member of the House of Commons. He was appointed a Knight Bachelor in the 2014 Birthday Honours for political services. He is a known critic of the European Union. In June 2023, he announced his intention to stand down at the 2024 general election. He is a distant cousin of the American country musician and singer Johnny Cash. ==References== ==Other websites== *Bill Cash personal website *Bill Cash MP biography at the site of the Conservative Party *ePolitix.com – Bill Cash *Guardian Unlimited Politics – Ask Aristotle: Bill Cash MP *BBC News profile (30 March 2006) * Category:1940 births Category:Living people Category:Conservative Party (UK) MPs Category:British political writers Category:Writers from London Category:Politicians from Staffordshire Category:UK MPs 1983–1987 Category:UK MPs 1987–1992 Category:UK MPs 1992–1997 Category:UK MPs 1997–2001 Category:UK MPs 2001–2005 Category:UK MPs 2005–2010 Category:UK MPs 2010–2015 Category:UK MPs 2015–2017 Category:UK MPs 2017–2019 Category:UK MPs 2019–2024
title: Bill Cash
